issues.solution: Check disk usage with 'df -h' and clear unnecessary files. Use 'du -sh *' to find large directories.
Check service status with 'systemctl status <service>' and inspect logs in /var/log. Ensure all dependencies are installed.
Identify the process causing high CPU usage with 'top' or 'htop'. Investigate further by checking application logs.
Use 'free -m' to check memory usage, and 'ps aux --sort=-%mem | head' to identify processes with high memory usage. Restart the problematic services.
Use 'ping', 'traceroute', and 'netstat' to diagnose network issues. Check firewall rules and network configurations.
